articles.description: The Kansas City Chiefs fight back to beat the San Francisco 49ers 25-22 in overtime and win their third Super Bowl in five years.
articles.title: Super Bowl 2024: Kansas City Chiefs defend NFL title after beating San Francisco 49ers in overtime

articles.description: Taylor Swift flies back from Tokyo to watch boyfriend Travis Kelce win the Super Bowl - what difference did it make?
articles.title: Taylor Swift at Super Bowl 58: How did pop star's attendance influence the NFL's big game

articles.description: Kelvin Kiptum, 24, was killed alongside his coach near the Kenyan town of Eldoret, an official says.
articles.title: Kenya's Kelvin Kiptum: Marathon world record holder dies in road accident

articles.description: Sebastien Haller is the hero again as Ivory Coast come from behind to beat Nigeria and win the 2023 Africa Cup of Nations final.
articles.title: Haller gives Ivory Coast victory in Afcon final
'They have momentum' - Man Utd 'hunting down' rivals

articles.description: Arsenal backed up their win against Liverpool with a thrashing of West Ham that has pundits believing they are "right in the title race".
articles.title: 'Great to make history' - 'massive' result puts Arsenal 'right in race'

articles.description: Two-time gold medallists Brazil will not feature in the Olympic men's football event for the first time since 2004 after losing to Argentina.
articles.title: Brazil miss out on Olympics as Argentina win to qualify

articles.description: Teenage winger Lamine Yamal scores twice as Barcelona come from behind to draw a six-goal thriller against La Liga strugglers Granada.
articles.title: Teenage winger Yamal scores twice as Barca are held

articles.description: After avoiding a slip-up against Italy, Ireland stay level-headed before more daunting games against Triple Crown rivals Wales, England and Scotland.
articles.title: 'Ireland remain on course but tougher tests await'

articles.description: Heather Watson and fellow Briton Harriet Dart are beaten in the doubles finals of the Abu Dhabi Open and Transylvania Open respectively.
articles.title: Heather Watson and Harriet Dart defeated in doubles finals in Cluj and Doha
